Posts.Content: Hilltopper Judy has provided a good summary and you definitely will find good support here when you have questions. I am on Letrozole only (after some spinal surgery and radiation). I have been relatively stable for almost 6 years and despite some minor side effects continue to be able to enjoy life. Good luck to your daughter and to you. I often think it is harder for our family (especially Mothers) to keep positive with this disease but with support you will find it a little easier to adjust to a ‘new normal’. Best wishes, Linda
Posts.Title: Cutting edge treatments and clinical trials for Stage IV Breast Cancer info

Posts.Content: I had it prior to surgery in 2013 for imminent spinal compression - I remember it caused my face to flush badly and I went to chemist to check with the pharmacist (it was the Sunday prior to my op on Monday). My blood pressure was up but she advised me to stay on it since it was only short term. I had only been on it for a couple of days.
Posts.Title: Dexamethasone and chemo

Posts.Content: We have all been at the place where you are now - confused, shocked and not sure what's ahead. Believe me, it will become easier with further understanding and (hopefully) information provided by your Oncologist on Monday. I was diagnosed in 2013 (Stage 4 from the outset). Doing well so far on Letrozole (I did have some spinal surgery to remove the met which was quite large in my Thoracic spine, followed by radiation). Don’t rely on old stats that you might read from the internet - we are very fortunate that research is moving at a fast pace and prognosis have improve exponentially. If you contact BestBird on this site (send her a direct message) she has very kindly and thoroughly put in great effort to compile a a comprehensive guide which she has recently updated. See BestBird’s post of February 19th - BB will send it to you, upon request. There is a table in the Guide (page 35 - "Conditional Survival") which provides hope for us all re the updated stats resulting from much improved treatment protocols over the last couple of decades. For example, a stat that continues to give me hope is that the one that states "At 5 years already survived MBC, the probability of five MORE years of relative survival of 56.9%" based on 2010 statistical analysis; however, "A more recent study of conditional survival in breast cancer data from SEER examined cases that were diagnosed during 2000-2008 and followed up through 2013 (states that) "Specific to distant breast cancer disease, the analysis indicated that five-year relative survival was 30%, and that the improvement in 5-year relative survival from diagnosis to five years already survived for distant disease was 91.4%". Thanks BestBird!! Hope this provides you with some comfort and hope - something we all need. Good luck with your new normal!
Posts.Title: Met Breast cancer to the bones

Posts.Content: Sounds the stuff of nightmares. Hope you have support to lodge a complaint.
Posts.Title: Has anyone been denied anasthesia when having a port placed?

Posts.Content: Hi BestBird would provide you with a copy of her Metastatic Guide to Breast Cancer - see her post of February 19th. It includes lots of very useful advice. Regards
Posts.Title: Met Breast cancer to the bones

Posts.Content: Hi Apologies, it used to be easy to find posts using User Names but that facility seems to have gone (or moved). Below is an extract of BestBird’s post providing her email contact: - hope this helps: Greetings, When contending with an initial diagnosis, treatment change, or side effect, it can be quite difficult to obtain current science-based information. When I was diagnosed with MBC in 2011, I began researching the disease and its treatments and shared my notes with other patients. In 2015 I organized everything into a .pdf entitled “The Insider’s Guide to Metastatic Breast Cancer” that I continually update and have forwarded free of charge to more than 3,100 patients and caregivers worldwide over the past 4 years. Those interested in receiving a copy may email me at bestbird@hotmail.com I’m delighted to say that “The Insider’s Guide to Metastatic Breast Cancer” is now offered in paperback and eBook format on Amazon at https://www.amazon.com/Insiders-Guide-Metastatic-Breast-Cancer/dp/179586060 X/ref=sr_1_fkmrnull_1?crid=2EL3W64I1UXA0&keywords=the+insider%27s+guide+to+ metastatic+breast+cancer&qid=1550509998&s=gateway&sprefix=insiders+guide+to +me%2Caps%2C684&sr=8-1-fkmrnull
Posts.Title: Met Breast cancer to the bones

Posts.Content: So sorry for your loss! I hope your memories sustain you in the coming months. Regards Linda
Posts.Title: In Memoriam, "New Challenges"

Posts.Content: Great news! Enjoy your drink of choice - hope it has an umbrella in it!
Posts.Title: Pretty good news Julesxx

Posts.Content: Well, I was diagnosed in mid 2013 (de novo) with bone Mets. So far, I have been on one treatment (after surgery and radiation for a spinal met). Letrozole seems to be keeping me stable and my Oncologist indicates that there are other tools available when needs be. Good luck and don’t ask random doctors for their prognosis - just keep on as best you can with a positive attitude - sometimes easier said than done, I know.
Posts.Title: Stage 4 long survival

Posts.Content: Great. I also found this site lifted a great weight when I first joined nearly 6 years ago. Shared experience is a comfort.
Posts.Title: Thank You Inspire Friends for Helping Me Get To This Point!
